item.title: Hugo x Github Pages
item.description: It has been 2 months since I switched from Hexo to Hugo. Everything went smoothly. Until yesterday, I made a small mistake. I messed up my entire blog Git repository, then I have to reconfigure the part of deploying Hugo website to Github Pages… To be honest, the initial configuration is simple but I cannot recall it at all. That’s why I finally decide to write down this quick note, for the forgetful people, like me.

item.title: Why Hugo Why Not Hexo
item.description: As you probably remember that I just about switched from jekyll to hexo 2 months ago, now I’m again switching from hexo to hugo. Am I crazy? Yep. You want to know why? Let me tell you. Why hexo was chosen? Let’s start from the reasons why I ditched jekyll without any regrets: Hexo has a good name Hexo is powered by Node.js Hexo is easy to deploy Hexo supports theme change Hexo is pretty fast Honestly hexo is quite good and I’m pretty happy living with it.
